description: Lists all patches eligible to be included in a patch baseline.

parameters.name: Filters
parameters.description: Each element in the array is a structure containing a key-value pair. Supported keys for Windows Server managed node patches include the following: PATCH_SET Sample values: OS | APPLICATION PRODUCT Sample values: WindowsServer2012 | Office 2010 | MicrosoftDefenderAntivirus PRODUCT_FAMILY Sample values: Windows | Office MSRC_SEVERITY Sample values: ServicePacks | Important | Moderate CLASSIFICATION Sample values: ServicePacks | SecurityUpdates | DefinitionUpdates PATCH_ID Sample values: KB123456 | KB4516046 Supported keys for Linux managed node patches include the following: PRODUCT Sample values: AmazonLinux2018.03 | AmazonLinux2.0 NAME Sample values: kernel-headers | samba-python | php SEVERITY Sample values: Critical | Important | Medium | Low EPOCH Sample values: 0 | 1 VERSION Sample values: 78.6.1 | 4.10.16 RELEASE Sample values: 9.56.amzn1 | 1.amzn2 ARCH Sample values: i686 | x86_64 REPOSITORY Sample values: Core | Updates ADVISORY_ID Sample values: ALAS-2018-1058 | ALAS2-2021-1594 CVE_ID Sample values: CVE-2018-3615 | CVE-2020-1472 BUGZILLA_ID Sample values: 1463241 (dict) --- Defines a filter used in Patch Manager APIs. Supported filter keys depend on the API operation that includes the filter. Patch Manager API operations that use PatchOrchestratorFilter include the following: DescribeAvailablePatches DescribeInstancePatches DescribePatchBaselines DescribePatchGroups Key (string) --- The key for the filter. Values (list) --- The value for the filter. (string) ---

nested_items.name: Patches
nested_items.description: An array of patches. Each entry in the array is a patch structure.

nested_items.name: Id
nested_items.description: The ID of the patch. Applies to Windows patches only.

nested_items.name: ReleaseDate
nested_items.description: The date the patch was released.

nested_items.name: Title
nested_items.description: The title of the patch.

nested_items.name: Description
nested_items.description: The description of the patch.

nested_items.name: ContentUrl
nested_items.description: The URL where more information can be obtained about the patch.

nested_items.name: Vendor
nested_items.description: The name of the vendor providing the patch.

nested_items.name: ProductFamily
nested_items.description: The product family the patch is applicable for. For example, Windows or Amazon Linux 2.

nested_items.name: Product
nested_items.description: The specific product the patch is applicable for. For example, WindowsServer2016 or AmazonLinux2018.03.

nested_items.name: Classification
nested_items.description: The classification of the patch. For example, SecurityUpdates, Updates, or CriticalUpdates.

nested_items.name: MsrcSeverity
nested_items.description: The severity of the patch, such as Critical, Important, or Moderate. Applies to Windows patches only.

nested_items.name: KbNumber
nested_items.description: The Microsoft Knowledge Base ID of the patch. Applies to Windows patches only.

nested_items.name: MsrcNumber
nested_items.description: The ID of the Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) bulletin the patch is related to. For example, MS14-045. Applies to Windows patches only.

nested_items.name: Language
nested_items.description: The language of the patch if it's language-specific.

nested_items.name: AdvisoryIds
nested_items.description: The Advisory ID of the patch. For example, RHSA-2020:3779. Applies to Linux-based managed nodes only.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: BugzillaIds
nested_items.description: The Bugzilla ID of the patch. For example, 1600646. Applies to Linux-based managed nodes only.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: CVEIds
nested_items.description: The Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVE) ID of the patch. For example, CVE-2011-3192. Applies to Linux-based managed nodes only.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the patch. Applies to Linux-based managed nodes only.

nested_items.name: Epoch
nested_items.description: The epoch of the patch. For example in pkg-example-EE-20180914-2.2.amzn1.noarch, the epoch value is 20180914-2. Applies to Linux-based managed nodes only.

nested_items.name: Version
nested_items.description: The version number of the patch. For example, in example-pkg-1.710.10-2.7.abcd.x86_64, the version number is indicated by -1. Applies to Linux-based managed nodes only.

nested_items.name: Release
nested_items.description: The particular release of a patch. For example, in pkg-example-EE-20180914-2.2.amzn1.noarch, the release is 2.amaz1. Applies to Linux-based managed nodes only.

nested_items.name: Arch
nested_items.description: The architecture of the patch. For example, in example-pkg-0.710.10-2.7.abcd.x86_64, the architecture is indicated by x86_64. Applies to Linux-based managed nodes only.

nested_items.name: Severity
nested_items.description: The severity level of the patch. For example, CRITICAL or MODERATE.

nested_items.name: Repository
nested_items.description: The source patch repository for the operating system and version, such as trusty-security for Ubuntu Server 14.04 LTE and focal-security for Ubuntu Server 20.04 LTE. Applies to Linux-based managed nodes only.

nested_items.name: NextToken
nested_items.description: The token to use when requesting the next set of items. If there are no additional items to return, the string is empty.
